name: Mixed Bag 24 Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Difficult [E] | 10 Questions

questions.text: How many stories high is Italy's 'Leaning Tower of Pisa'?
questions.explanation:
8.

	It is a free standing bell tower associated with the cathedral and the baptistery.

questions.text: Randall's and Ward's Islands are considered part of which New York City borough?
questions.explanation:
Manhattan.

	Manhattan encompasses a small exclave (Marble Hill), and several islands in the East River including Randall's, Ward's, Governor's and Franklin D. Roosevelt Island.

questions.text: Wheeling, West Virgina, lies on the east bank of what river?
questions.explanation:
Ohio.

	It is located in the northern panhandle. It was settled in 1769 and incorporated as a city in 1836.

questions.text: On what date does the US government begin its fiscal year?
questions.explanation:
October 1st.

	It is a twelve month period used by government as a financial period.

questions.text: What is the name for the lowest part of a ship's hold?
What state was Madonna born in?
questions.explanation:
Michigan.

	She was born Madonna Louise Ciccone in Bay City, Michigan in 1958.

questions.text: Who wrote the autobiography 'My Wicked, Wicked Ways'?
questions.explanation:
Errol Flynn.

	He was born in Australia in 1909. He died of a heart attack at age 50 and his autobiography was published posthumously in 1959.

questions.text: What was the address of Fibber McGee's house both on radio and on TV?
questions.explanation:
79 Wistful Vista.

	It was on TV from September 1959 to January 1960. It was much more popular as a radio show.

questions.text: How many kilometers in a standard or land mile?
questions.explanation:
1.6

	There are 1.85 in a nautical mile.

questions.text: Which United States president said ' A house divided against itself cannot stand'?
questions.explanation:
Lincoln.

	It was said in his acceptance speech at the Republican state convention in 1858.
